page.title: 17Our Houses
page.content: 65% of the children in Waterhouses Middle School live in a village. 21% of the children live in houses which have only a few other houses around them. 3.5% live in public houses. Most of the houses are made of either limestone or sandstone. Most of us live in detached houses. Some of us live in ordinary houses and some in farmhouses, bungalows and cottages but some children have more unusual homes: Lisa lives in a caravan while her parents are changing one of the old village schools into a house. Damon's house was once a pig sty and farm buildings. David's house used to be a chapel. The main problem in converting it was dividing up the large space into rooms. Tracey's house was once a railway signal man's house but there is no railway now.
